definition: to get the materials ready/to prepare feed (for livestock)
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: The technical requirement and related equipment of strip stock are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 探讨了扁钢备料工艺要求及设备。

sentences.english: The purchasing agent rushes around every day to secure materials.
sentences.chinese: 采购员天天为备料东奔西走。

sentences.english: Clamp machine of billet material is used at the working procedure of stock heat up stove.
sentences.chinese: 钢坯夹持机是用于型钢厂加热炉的备料工序。

sentences.english: Bonded factory and materials bonded warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 保税工厂和备料保税仓库。

sentences.english: Fully stocked gourmet kitchen features the best of the best in appliances and design.
sentences.chinese: 备料充足的美食家厨房拥有一流的设备和设计。

sentences.english: The outlook for demand is good because some processors will start stockpiling soon for the Dragon Boat Festival holiday.
sentences.chinese: 需求依然良好，因为部分加工商将会于端午节前备料。

sentences.english: Collection of modern cutting boards designed to make food preparation more efficient and enjoyable.
sentences.chinese: 收集现代砧板设计，享受备料的乐趣。

sentences.english: Surplus product by quarrying for logging, since the transport preparation, with the chips built with the.
sentences.chinese: 所积盈余用以伐木采石，自运备料，随筹随建。

sentences.english: I also did some food preparation by chopping veggies (carrot and celery sticks).
sentences.chinese: 然后又切了些胡萝卜和芹菜丝作为色拉的备料。

definition: ingredients (in a cooking recipe)/to mix materials according to directions
to slice/slice/thin section of a specimen (for microscopic examination)
to feed in/to load (raw material, supplies, fuel etc)/to supply/fortified (with added material)
(at a restaurant) to bring a dish to a customer/to serve food
